It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its tree-like appearance with a tall, unbranched stem. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces small, spore-bearing structures called strobili at the top of its stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
